author: Anita Balakrishnan
title: Apple AAPL all-time intraday high
text:
Shares of Apple 's stock set another record on Tuesday, hitting its all-time intraday high.
Apple rose nearly 1 percent on Tuesday and briefly passed the previous record of $134.54, set in April 2015. The record-setting trading came after Apple set a new record closing high on Monday of $133.29 a share.
Apple is a closely watched stock, thanks to its massive size.
Hitting a market capitalization of around $701 billion on Monday, Apple briefly crested the $700 billion level it last broke in February 2015. Wall Street has given positive outlooks for the next iPhone, as Apple returned to revenue growth this year.
Microsoft , Alphabet , Netflix and Facebook have hit all-time intraday highs this year. The S&P 500, Dow Jones industrial average and Nasdaq all hit record highs on Monday, despite trading in relatively narrow range for most of 2017.
